title: Germany Needs Coal to Replace Gas, So a Village Has to Go
description: The cutting of Russian gas supplies to Europe has led Germany to step up coal use, despite its goal to phase it out by 2030.
dc:creator: Christopher F. Schuetze and Erika Solomon
media:credit: Ingmar Nolting for The New York Times
media:description: An excavator working at the Garzweiler open-pit coal mine in Germany in August. The prospect of a winter without cheap Russian gas has dampened interest in greener policies.
